name: dns_hijack-hardcoded_domains
description: This kernel module contains hardcoded DNS redirection-related domain names and IP addresses, including '.routerlogin.com', '.routerlogin.net', 'www.routerlogin.net', 'www.routerlogin.com', and '1.0.0.127.in-addr.arpa'. These addresses may be used for DNS hijacking functionality, implemented through the functions 'dnsRedirect_isNeedRedirect' and 'dnsRedirect_dnsHookFn'. While no traditional credentials were found, this DNS redirection feature could potentially be exploited for malicious purposes.
notes:
configuration_load

It is recommended to further analyze the module's function implementations to understand the complete DNS hijacking behavior. While no traditional credentials were found, this functionality itself may constitute a security risk.

name: NetUSB-configurable_parameters

While these parameters themselves do not contain sensitive data, improper configuration may pose security risks. It is recommended to verify the actual parameter values configured during module loading.
notes: It is recommended to verify the actual parameter values during module loading to ensure there are no improper security settings. Although no hardcoded credentials were found, improper configuration of module parameters may pose security risks.
